title: Beef and Broccoli Lo Mein
directions: In a small bowl, whisk 1 cup reduced-sodium beef broth, 3 tbsp each reduced-sodium soy sauce and ketchup, 1 tbsp each rice vinegar and cornstarch and 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes. Set aside. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add 1 large head broccoli, cut into florets, return to a boil and cook 3 minutes. Scoop out broccoli with a slotted spoon and reserve. In same pot, cook 1/2 lb whole-grain linguine (such as Barilla) for 6 minutes; drain and set aside. In a large nonstick skillet, heat 2 tbsp canola oil over medium-high. Add 1/2 lb flank steak, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices, and 1 large green bell pepper, cored, seeded and thinly sliced; stir-fry 3 minutes. Stir in sauce and simmer 1 minute, until thickened. Add broccoli and 1 can (8 oz) chopped water chestnuts, drained; cook 2 minutes. Toss with pasta and serve immediately.
To keep flank and other types of steak tender while cooking, slice against the grain.
Nutrition Information for Beef and Broccoli Lo Mein
PER SERVING: 453 cal., 12 g total fat 689 mg sodium, 63 g carb. (7 g fiber), 26 g pro.
